issue.description: MIM needs to interface with Extended_measure_representation

comment.description: Added.

issue.description: ARM needs to interface with Extended_measure_representation

comment.description: Added.

issue.description: MIM needs to USE FROM qualified_measure_schema.measure_qualification

comment.description: Accept. Added to mim, also added value_qualifier, to be explicit.

issue.description: Mapping of value range uses compound_representation_item instead of qualified measure_representation.

comment.description: This is a major harmonization issue. Agreement in principle to adopt Bill Danner proposal to include both 214 of 224 methoods in ARM, and their respective mappings. This will enable APs that use GDT modules to interoperate with either.
Fixed. By agreement of GDT harmonization team, a new ARM element Tolerance_range was created that does not use compound_representation_item.

issue.description: Mapping of envelope principle is not harmonized with AP224.

comment.description: This is a major harmonization issue.
Harmonization team reached agreement. Has been incorporated into module.

issue.description: Harmonization with ISO 10303-214 is required. Resolution of AP214 SEDS 887-896 and AM 1050 should be consistent.

comment.description: Harmonization team has reached agreement

issue.description: Angular_location_dimension.orientation The definition of the attribute orientation is not clear. Does the attribute define a kind of reference plane for measurement of the angle? Improve the textual definition. Consider to add an explanatory figure.

comment.description: Wording will be improved

issue.description: 4.3.7 Limits_and_fits attribute definitions The notes are not numbered.

comment.description: See UK9

issue.description: 4.3.9 Location_dimension directed attribute definition A reference to the name of the own entity has a link. Remove the link and leave the reference in bold letters.

comment.description: Accept. Fixed.

issue.description: 4.3.10 Plus_minus_bounds attribute definitions The numbering of the notes is incorrect.

comment.description: See UK12

issue.description: 5.1 Mapping specification The attribute Location_dimension.origin has not been mapped to the extended select placed_element_select

comment.description: Accept. Fixed.

issue.description: The attribute Size_dimension.applied_to has not been mapped to the extended select element_with_dimension_select

comment.description: Accept. Fixed.

issue.description: Figure D.1 The entities used from representation_schema are related to Elemental_geometric_shape_mim.

comment.description: Because of limitations of the tools, in order for the diagram links to work properly, whenever an interfaced entity is referenced , it is necessary to explicitly USE FROM the schema where the interfaced entity is originally defined, regardless of any indirect interfacing that may exist. Not sure that this is correct interpretation of issue?
Will add as proposed future enhancement to repository

issue.description: In SC4 Poitiers Meeting, WG3/T24 manufacturing team determined to establish an Ad-Hoc committee for the harmonization of Geometric and Dimensional Tolerance defined in AP 214, AP 224 and AM 1050. It is required to harmonize the definition and the representation of the dimensional tolerance with AP 214 and AP 224.

comment.description: Accept. GDT team formed.
Work completed.

issue.description: ARM entity Location_dimension is mapped to the resource entity dimensional_location (Part 47), which represents the relative location between a pair of shape aspects. However, the following two attributes, origin and target, may be a geometric_representation_item, such as Axis_placement.origin: the element that is the origin for the Location_dimension.target: the element that is the target for the Location_dimension. Confirm the consistency with the dimensional_location in Part 47.

comment.description: Keep as-is. Entities and mapping are harmonized with AP214.

issue.description: EXPRESS-G ARM Diagram 2 Technical Not Harmonized with AP214e2Location_dimension Attribute: Directed Remove attribute - directed to harmonize

comment.description: Any dimension can be directed. SEDS has been submitted against AP214.

issue.description: Diagram 2 Technical Not Harmonized with AP214e2Angular_location_dimension Attribute: orientation Remove attribute - orientation to harmonize Add attributes: mirror_target, Major_angle, origin_determination

comment.description: Angular_location_dimension.orientation orientation is needed to determine correct sense of rotation. SEDS submitted against AP214. Reject per Len

issue.description: EXPRESS-G ARM Diagram 2 Technical Not Harmonized with AP214e2Linear_distance_dimension Attribute missing - directed Remove attribute - directed to harmonize

comment.description: Attribute is on supertype Location_dimension

issue.description: EXPRESS-G ARM Diagram 2 Technical Not Harmonized with AP214e2Size_dimension Attribute - envelope_principle Remove attribute - envelope_principle to harmonize

comment.description: The envelope principle simultaneously controls size and form and is potentially applicable to any feature of size (FOS), regardless of how the dimension and or tolerance are specified. Attribute is optional, so not a UC problem.

issue.description: EXPRESS-G ARM Diagram 1,2 Technical Not Harmonized with AP214e2Geometric_dimension Attribute dimensional_valueDimensional_value references a select type: dimension_value_select. One of the items in the selection is Dimension_value_with_limitations. This entity does not define a value that the plus_minus_bounds, or limits_and_fits is applied to. Harmonize with AP214e2 and define a numerical_value to apply the dimensional tolerance.

comment.description: Added attribute Dimension_value_with_limitation.limited_value as a Numerical_item_with_unit.

issue.description: EXPRESS-G ARM Diagram 2 Technical Not Harmonized with AP224e2Sub types for Size_dimension missing Harmonize with AP224e2 Add these subtypes:Radial_dimension Angular_size_dimension Curved_dimension Diameter_dimension

comment.description:
Angular_size_dimension exists in ARM. Minor difference from 224 in one arm attribute: full_or_half vs full , mapping the same.
For the others, Propose instead, to maintain 214 harmonization to add as values for General_size_dimension.dimension_type, in the form "when applicable the following values shall be used.
Added text strings to be used where applicable, to the ARM descriptions and also as alternative constrained mappings. This method of specifying an open list was is consistent with an agreement between AP214e1 project team and SC4 quality.
Modules harmonized with AP214 and 224 by WG3 team.

issue.description: Major Technical There are many APs using dimensional tolerances: AP224, AP240, AP219, AP238, AP214, AP223, etc It is very important that this module be harmonized with those APs.Currently all of the APs are trying to harmonize with AP214e2. Harmonize module with AP214e2

comment.description: Modules harmonized with AP214 and 224 by WG3 team.

issue.description: Does not specify how to encode taper ratios Document, possibly as ratio units

comment.description: Check on whether parametrics can treat this
Out of scope for this stage

issue.description: Does not specify how to encode fractional dimensions Document, possibly as ratio units.

comment.description: Check on whether parametrics can treat this
Defer to later edition.

issue.description: No way is given to distinguish theoretically exact ("basic") dimensions from dimensions that may be affected by default tolerances. Create new ARM entity type (ref AP210) THEORETICALLY_EXACT_DIMENSION_REPRESENTATION maps to {shape_dimension_representation <=shape_representation <=representationrepresentation.items[1] ->representation_item =>measure_representation_item <=measure_with_unit <-measure_qualification.qualified_measuremeasure_qualification{measure_qualification.name = `dimension value qualifier'}measure_qualification.qualifiers[i] ->value_qualifiervalue_qualifier = type_qualifiertype_qualifier{type_qualifier.name = `theoretically exact'}}

comment.description: No change to ARM. Handle with qualifiers - allow for classification and reference data. Consider a SEDS against AP214 and extended_measure_representation to allow more qualifiers.
Harmonization team agreed this would be a note, modeled as a descriptive_representation_item. Not sure how to handle notes on size_dimension.

issue.description: No association of material modifier to a sizing tolerance for form tolerances.

comment.description: Submit as SEDS for AIC 519 and part 47

issue.description: No way is documented to specify a statistical tolerance and alternate tolerance for dimensional tolerance

comment.description: Out of scope for this stage

issue.description: Incomplete support for dimension characterstics. Examples: angular, arc length, controlled radius, diameter, spherical diameter linear, radius Add missing ones.

comment.description: See also US6.
New subtypes created for radial, angular, arc lenght, diameter, cases. Others to be modeled as a additional descriptive representation items, or as classifications.

issue.description: 4.3.8 Linear_distance_dimension. Name is misleading because linear refers to measures of length whether straight or not. Change to Straight_distance_dimension, and change mapping string to "straight distance"

comment.description: Provide usage guidance

issue.description: Not clear if concept of auxiliary (reference) dimension is to be supported. Clarify and add if missing.

comment.description: Harmonization team agreed these will be additional representation items on location dimensions. Not sure about size.

issue.description: 4.3.12 No indication is given of when this might be used. Add example of retained thickness of a blind hole, or of a web, if these are appropriate.

comment.description: Added example as proposed, also example of surface finish thickness.

issue.description: The representation of geometric dimensioning and tolerancing in ISO 10303-1050 is not harmonized with existing representations in already published ISO 10303 standards. Both ISO 10303-214 and 224 have geometric dimensioning and tolerancing. These APs have some harmonization issues to resolve and ISO 10303-1050 should take part in that harmonization effort.

comment.description: Harmonization team has provisional agreements for all issues.

issue.description: Diagram 2 Major Technical This module has not been harmonised with AP224 edition 2 (or Ap214 edition 2). Harmonise with AP224 edition 2.

comment.description: Harmonization team has resolved most issues.
ARM concepts harmonized by wg3 harmonmization team. Some differences in names of individual entities remain.

issue.description: Diagram 2 Technical Not harmonised with AP224 edition 2Linear_distance_dimension has an optional attribute orientation but has not a directed attribute as found in AP224 edition2 Location_dimension_tolerance Harmonise with AP224 edition 2 by adding directed attribute.

comment.description: ARM concepts harmonized by wg3 harmonmization team. Some differences in names of individual entities remain.

issue.description: Diagram 2 Technical Not harmonised with AP224 edition 2Angular_location_dimension has an optional attribute orientation but not the major_angle mirror_target or mirror_termination attribute present in AP224 edition2 Angular_dimension_tolerance Harmonise with AP224 edition 2 by removing orientation attribute and adding major_angle, mirror_target and mirror_termination.

comment.description: ARM concepts harmonized by wg3 harmonmization team. Some differences in names of individual entities remain.

issue.description: Diagram 2 Technical Not harmonised with AP224 edition 2Size_dimension has an attribute envelope_principle which is not present in AP224 edition2 Size_tolerance. However, Applied_shape from AP224 edition 2 is not present. Harmonise with AP224 edition 2 by removing envelope_principle attribute and adding attribute Applied_shape.

comment.description: ARM concepts harmonized by wg3 harmonmization team. Some differences in names of individual entities remain.

issue.description: In-scope point 4 "dimensions of size", please clarify.Out-scope point 6 "presentaion", please clarify.

comment.description: Accept. Improved text and added examples for point 4. Expanded wording for point 6.

issue.description: Curved_distance_dimension.used_path Definition incomplete

comment.description: Accept. Fixed by completing the definition

issue.description: Dimension_value_with_limitiation Definition and definition of "defined_by" are not understandable.

comment.description: An attribute defined_by was accidentally left out of the ARM. Added this attribute and changed descriptions of entity and attributes.

issue.description: Geometric_dimension EXPRESS-G (diagram C2) does not agree with the EXPRESS, in that it omits the ONEOF constraint

comment.description: Accept. Authoring tool does not support this. Will fix by editing the final diagram.
Fixed.

issue.description: Limits_and_fits Examples and notes incorrectly numbered

comment.description: Accept. Fixed.

issue.description: Limits_and_fits:deviation The scope and meaning of the parameter is not correctly defined. It should explicitly reference ISO 286 as the source of valid values

comment.description: Accept. However, not all uses of limits and fits will be per ISO.

issue.description: Limits_and_fits:Fitting_type The description suggests that this should be an enumeration. Otherwise, some definition of the valid strings is required. (Classification with External_class_library is another option).

comment.description: Reject. Required for AP214 harmonization. Accept in principle. This attribute is redundant, or at least could be derived. For harmonization reasons, propose this issue be addressed in an implementation module. Added text with applicable strings to ARM description.

issue.description: Plus_minus_bounds Note numbering out of sequence

comment.description: Accept. Fixed.

issue.description: Plus_minus_bounds According to the mapping, the values in the EXAMPLE are normative, and should be part of the attribute definition. This would be better either as an enumeration or done through classification

comment.description: Reject. This wording and mapping were per SC4 agreement when AP214 was developed. It is retained for harmonizations. NOTE classification may be added at the implementation level.

issue.description: The mappings are unsafe, in that it may not be possible to recover the meaning of the ARM when examining, say, a part 21 file. It is strongly recommended that the mappings are re-examined from this point of view, and that the mapping path is constrained, for example, by a representation_contex

comment.description: Please provide a concrete example.
All mappings harmonized.

issue.description: Dimension_value_with_limitation.envelope_principle Mapping incorrect. There is no way of telling a TRUE from a FALSE

comment.description: Accept. Changed text and added alternative mappings.

issue.description: Size_dimension.envelope_principle Mapping incorrect. There is no way of telling a TRUE from a FALSE

comment.description: Accept. Changed description in ARM and added alternative mappings.

issue.description: Mappings for dimension value with limitation to numerical item with unit and limits and fits are switched.

comment.description: Accept. Fixed.

issue.description: Off page references are wrong.

comment.description: Fixed. Re-ordered pages in GE/viseo.

issue.description: Missing mappings for assertions from Location_dimension.origin and target to Point_on_curve, Point_on_surface, Curve, Surface. Issue found during build of AP203 e2 TS confirmatory ballot.

comment.description: Added mappings.

issue.description: Error in two places ... descriptive_representation_item -> descriptive_representation_item.description ) Should be descriptive_representation_item descriptive_representation_item.description )

comment.description: Fixed as proposed.

issue.description: Mapping contains syntax errors in two places: ... {representation.items[i] -> representation_item.name = 'radius type'} *) ... should be representation.items[i] -> representation_item {representation_item.name = 'radius type'} ....

comment.description: Fixed as proposed.

issue.description: Size_dimension.envelope_principle Alternative #2: "NO MAPPING" for mimelt is not a standardized string and is not a mapping. Ref QCN241 9.3 Example 3

comment.description: Removed <aimelt> from alternative 2 and reworded description.

issue.description: error in mapping .... externally_defined_dimension_definition <= dimensional_size -> dimensional_size.name should be ... externally_defined_dimension_definition <= dimensional_size dimensional_size.name

comment.description: Fixed as proposed.

issue.description: Syntax errors in the mapping.... should be ... measure_with_unit <- .... add measure_qualification.qualified_measure measure_qualification ... end add measure_qualification.qualifiers[1] -> value_qualifier = precision_qualifier precision_qualifier precision_qualifier.precision_value

comment.description: Fixed as proposed.

issue.description: Externally_defined_size_dimension.used_path should be slightly modified: ... add to beginning externally_defined_dimension_definition <= dimensional_size => ... end add dimensional_size_with_path dimensional_size_with_path.path -> shape_aspect shape_definition = shape_aspect ...

comment.description: Fixed as proposed.

issue.description:
An Externally_defined_size_dimension shall have a an associated document. In the GDT Harmonization Workshops it was agreed that a rule requiring this should be added.
Conditions Under Which the Issue Was Discovered: Incorporation of the agreed solutions in AP214
Proposed Solution (Optional): Add the following text in clause 4.3.7: Each Externally_defined_size_dimension shall be referenced by a Document_assignment.

comment.description: Fixed as proposed.

issue.description:
ISO/IS 10303-1050:2005 (§4.3.15 Radial_size_dimension) Other Parts Affected by the Issue: Problem Description: Radius_type has an open list of applicable values, where two ( "adjoining", "centred") are predefined. The value should be restricted to these two values.
Conditions Under Which the Issue Was Discovered: Incorporation of the agreed solutions in AP214
Proposed Solution (Optional): Replace the sentence "Where applicable the following values shall be used:" by "The following values shall be used:"

comment.description: Modified as proposed.

issue.description:
aux ISO/IS 10303-1050:2005 (§4.3.16 Size_dimension) Other Parts Affected by the Issue: Problem Description: As response to SEDS971 it was decided in the Harmonization workshop to add the following NOTE to Size_dimension:
NOTE Size_dimension as defined in this part of ISO 10303 describe an intrinsic length or angle characteristic of part shape. This includes characteristics of what are traditionally called features-of-size, but they are not limited to that usage alone. For example, the radial_size_dimension and curved_size_dimension application objects describe characteristics which may not be applied to features-of-size.
Conditions Under Which the Issue Was Discovered: Incorporation of the agreed solutions in AP214
Proposed Solution (Optional): Add the note.

comment.description: Added note.

issue.description:
Part/Clause Affected by the Issue: ISO/IS 10303-1050:2005 (§5.1.3.1 Angular_size_dimension.full) Other Parts Affected by the Issue: Problem Description: The boolean attribute full maps to 2 string values 'full angle' and 'half angle'. The mapping is not clear on which values maps to what.
Conditions Under Which the Issue Was Discovered: Incorporation of the agreed solutions in AP214
Proposed Solution (Optional): Add the following OR case: #1: If the angle is established between the two sides of the angular element. #2: If the angle is established between the bisector line and the angular element.
Modify the reference path as follows: angular_size <= dimensional_size dimensional_characteristic = dimensional_size dimensional_characteristic <- dimensional_characteristic_representation.dimension dimensional_characteristic_representation dimensional_characteristic_representation.representation -> shape_dimension_representation <= shape_representation <= representation representation.items[i] -> representation_item {#1:(representation_item.name = 'full angle') (#2:representation_item.name = 'half angle')}

comment.description: Added alternative.

issue.description:
For the attribute notes two permissive list values are defined: 'auxiliary'and 'theoretical'. This should be reflected in the mapping.
Conditions Under Which the Issue Was Discovered: Incorporation of the agreed solutions in AP214
Proposed Solution (Optional):
Correct the reference path as follows:
for OR case #1: (dimensional_location dimensional_characteristic = dimensional_location dimensional_characteristic <- dimensional_characteristic_representation.dimension dimensional_characteristic_representation dimensional_characteristic_representation.representation -> shape_dimension_representation <= shape_representation <= representation representation.items[i] -> representation_item {representation_item.name = 'dimensional note'} representation_item => descriptive_representation_item descriptive_representation_item.description {( descriptive_representation_item.description) (descriptive_representation_item.description = 'auxiliary') (descriptive_representation_item.description = 'theoretical')})
for OR case #2: (dimensional_size dimensional_characteristic = dimensional_size dimensional_characteristic <- dimensional_characteristic_representation.dimension dimensional_characteristic_representation dimensional_characteristic_representation.representation -> shape_dimension_representation <= shape_representation <= representation representation.items[i] -> representation_item => descriptive_representation_item descriptive_representation_item.description {( descriptive_representation_item.description) (descriptive_representation_item.description = 'auxiliary) (descriptive_representation_item.description = 'theoretical)})

comment.description: Fixed as proposed.

issue.description:
The OR case description is wrong. The OR case is independent, whether the orientation is specified or not.
Conditions Under Which the Issue Was Discovered: Incorporation of the agreed solutions in AP214
Proposed Solution (Optional):
Replace the OR case description as follows: #1: If directed is 'false'. #2: If the directed is 'true'.

comment.description: Fixed as proposed.

issue.description:
Section 2. ENHANCEMENT AND DISCREPANCY INFORMATION (completed by author of SEDS Report): Author: Max Ungerer (max.ungerer@prostep.com) Submitted by: Germany Part/Clause Affected by the Issue: ISO/IS 10303-1050:2005 (§5.1.14 Location_dimension) Other Parts Affected by the Issue: Problem Description: The reference path for 5.1.14.3 and 5.1.14.4 are wrong: ".related_shape_aspect" must be ".relating_shape_aspect".
Conditions Under Which the Issue Was Discovered: Incorporation of the agreed solutions in AP214
Proposed Solution (Optional):
In 5.1.14.3 replace the reference path by: dimensional_location <= shape_aspect_relationship shape_aspect_relationship.relating_shape_aspect
In 5.1.14.4 replace the reference path by: (dimensional_location <= shape_aspect_relationship shape_aspect_relationship.relating_shape_aspect -> shape_aspect)

comment.description: Fixed as proposed.

issue.description:
The mapping restricts the constructive elements for origin and target to be geometric_representation_items. Topological elements are not allowed. I don't understand that restriction. Topological elements should be allowed, too
Conditions Under Which the Issue Was Discovered: Incorporation of the agreed solutions in AP214
Proposed Solution (Optional):
Terminate the reference path for both origin and target by representation_item instead of geometric_representation_item.

comment.description: Fixes as proposed.

issue.description:
(§5.1.7.2 Dimension_value_with_limitation.limited_value) Other Parts Affected by the Issue: Problem Description: The current reference path includes dimension_size. This restricts the association of Dimension_value_with_limitation to Size_dimension. Location_dimension is therewith excluded.
Conditions Under Which the Issue Was Discovered: Incorporation of the agreed solutions in AP214

comment.description: Created an alternative mapping for dimensional_location

issue.description: ISO 1101 Normative reference (ISO 1101:1983) has now been withdrawn and replaced by a new document with the following, modified title: ISO 1101:2004, Geometrical Product Specifications (GPS) - Geometrical tolerancing - Tolerancing of form, orientation, location and run-out. (Please note that the 1983 edition can in any case no longer be cited because the document itself is no longer publicly available)

comment.description: Fixed in normrefs.xml

issue.description: ISO 286-1 and ISO 286-2 These two documents are wrongly dated and should be listed as ISO 286-1:1988 and ISO 286-2:1988 respectively (instead of 1998).

comment.description: Fixed in normrefs.xml
